message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.LG 

This paper deals with the problem of distinguishing between refracted and Lambertian image features using a light field camera, which is a topic related to computer vision (cs.CV) and robotics (cs.RO). The proposed method involves using textural cross-correlation to characterise apparent feature motion in a single light field, which is a technique that falls under the category of graphics (cs.GR). The paper also discusses the application of the proposed method to structure from motion, which is a topic related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG).
